snippet: Consumers increased their borrowing in December, with credit cards rising at the fastest pace in eight months.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports increased consumer borrowing in December 2014, expansion of $14.8 billion, which pushes consumer debt to record $3.31 trillion; expansion may indicate that consumer spending will increase as shoppers gain confidence from strong jobs data to increase their debt.
lead_paragraph: Consumers increased their borrowing in December, with credit cards rising at the fastest pace in eight months.

headline.main: Borrowing Increased by $14.8 Billion in December
headline.print_headline: Borrowing Increased by $14.8 Billion in December
